name: Viral Hepatitis
description: A viral infection causing liver inflammation, often leading to jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
causes: Infection by hepatitis viruses (A, B, C, D, or E), contaminated food/water, or blood contact.
prevention: Vaccination (for Hepatitis A and B), safe food/water practices, avoiding needle sharing.
treatment: Rest, hydration, antiviral medications for chronic cases (e.g., Hepatitis C).

medicines.name: Paracetamol
medicines.allergies_warning: Avoid if allergic to paracetamol or with liver disease.

medicines.name: Omeprazole
medicines.allergies_warning: Avoid if allergic to proton pump inhibitors.

medicines.name: Vitamin C
medicines.allergies_warning: Avoid if allergic to ascorbic acid.

name: Gastroenteritis
description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, causing diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal pain.
causes: Viral (e.g., norovirus), bacterial (e.g., E. coli), or parasitic infections; contaminated food/water.
prevention: Hand hygiene, safe food preparation, clean drinking water.

medicines.name: Paracetamol
medicines.allergies_warning: Avoid if allergic to paracetamol or with liver disease.

medicines.name: Loperamide
medicines.allergies_warning: Avoid if allergic to loperamide or with bacterial enteritis.

name: Typhoid Fever
description: A bacterial infection causing fever, diarrhea, and sometimes jaundice due to Salmonella typhi.
causes: Ingestion of contaminated food or water with Salmonella typhi.
prevention: Typhoid vaccination, safe food/water practices, hand hygiene.

medicines.name: Paracetamol
medicines.allergies_warning: Avoid if allergic to paracetamol or with liver disease.

name: Amoebiasis
description: A parasitic infection causing diarrhea and potential liver abscesses, often linked to Entamoeba histolytica.
causes: Ingestion of contaminated food/water with Entamoeba histolytica cysts.
prevention: Safe drinking water, proper sanitation, hand hygiene.

medicines.name: Paracetamol
medicines.allergies_warning: Avoid if allergic to paracetamol or with liver disease.
